item.title: 投机交易员因关税将日元看涨押注推升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战推动了美国资产的抛售，并刺激了避险需求，投机交易员对日元的看涨程度创下历史之最。【原文：Speculative traders became most bullish on the yen on record as President Donald Trump’s trade war drives selling of US assets and boosts haven demand.】

item.title: 马航寻求波音飞机，因为中国停止交付：马来西亚
item.description: 据《伯纳马报》周日报道，马来西亚航空集团有限公司（Malaysia Aviation Group Bhd.【原文：Malaysia Aviation Group Bhd. is in talks with Boeing Co. to potentially take over delivery slots vacated by Chinese carriers as the US-China trade war heats up, Bernama reported Sunday.】

item.title: 韩国总统候选人誓言提振股市
item.description: 韩国总统选举的领跑者李在明（Lee Jae-myung）表示，他将对韩国股票市场进行改革，以杜绝股票操纵行为并保护股东。【原文：Lee Jae-myung, South Korea’s presidential-election front-runner, said he would make changes to the nation’s equity markets to eradicate stock manipulation and protect shareholders.】

item.title: 尽管冶炼费用低廉，中国铜产量仍跃升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于黄金和硫酸等副产品价格上涨，缓解了利润压力，中国铜冶炼厂上月产量创下历史新高。【原文：Chinese copper smelters boosted output to a record high last month, as rising prices for by-products including gold and sulphuric acid eased pressure on margins.】

item.title: 特朗普反对杰罗姆-鲍威尔成为抛售美元的最新理由
item.description: 周一，在唐纳德-特朗普总统考虑是否能够解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔之际，抛售美元的交易势头有所增强。【原文：The sell-dollar trade gathered momentum on Monday as President Donald Trump contemplated whether he’s able to fire Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 特斯拉公牛发出 "红色警报"，称马斯克需要离开 DOGE
item.description: Wedbush Securities 分析师丹-艾夫斯（Dan Ives）为特斯拉公司再次敲响了警钟，他警告说，在这家电动汽车制造商准备于周二公布第一季度财报之际，首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）将面临自己的岔路口。【原文：Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives is sounding another loud alarm bell for Tesla Inc., warning that CEO Elon Musk faces his own fork in the road as the electric vehicle maker prepares to report first quarter earnings Tuesday.】

item.title: 贸易战忧虑和美元走软引发黄金反弹，创下历史新高
item.description: 未来几天将公布的数据可能会凸显出全球经济受到损害的早期迹象，因此，美国主导的贸易战削弱了市场对避险资产的需求，黄金创下历史新高。【原文：Gold hit a record as the debilitating US-led trade war underpinned demand for haven assets, with data due in the coming days that may highlight early signs of damage to the global economy.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据显示关税后出口萎缩
item.description: 韩国的早期贸易数据显示，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）加大关税力度后，本月迄今为止出口萎缩，给这个亚洲出口大国的增长前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：South Korea’s early trade data showed that exports contracted so far this month after Donald Trump stepped up his tariff campaign, clouding the growth outlook for the Asian export powerhouse.】

item.title: 乌克兰与俄罗斯停战，美国与伊朗会谈成为焦点，石油价格下跌
item.description: 由于交易商担心美国主导的贸易战对能源需求的影响，同时关注华盛顿与德黑兰就伊斯兰共和国核计划举行的会谈，石油价格有所回落。【原文：Oil retreated as traders fretted about the impact of the US-led trade war on energy demand, while monitoring talks between Washington and Tehran over the Islamic republic’s nuclear program.】

item.title: 新加坡的长期债务因 2022 年以来最陡峭的曲线而得到提振
item.description: 新加坡债券的收益率曲线是约三年来最陡峭的，这预示着投资者在本月的拍卖会上购买长期债务的时机已经成熟。【原文：The steepest yield curve on Singapore’s bonds in about three years is signaling the time may be propitious for investors to buy long-dated debt at an auction this month.】

item.title: 各国央行凝视贸易战深渊，降息准备就绪
item.description: 未来几个月，全球央行大多将做好降息的准备，以缓解美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战对其经济的影响。【原文：Global central banks will mostly stand ready for interest-rate cuts in coming months to cushion their economies from US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 亚洲股市开盘涨跌不一，美国期货下跌：市场综述
item.description: 周一亚洲股市将继续保持低迷，成交量可能稀少，一些地区市场仍因复活节假期休市，缺乏直接的交易催化剂。【原文：Asian stocks are set to remain muted in likely thin volumes on Monday with a number of regional markets still shut for Easter holidays and a lack of immediate trading catalysts.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 油价上涨，美国的钻井平台也随之上涨，页岩地区的钻井平台一直处于闲置状态。彭博全球能源论坛（BloombergNEF）在本月晚些时候于纽约召开峰会之前发布了最新的能源展望。中国正在防范的稀土金属究竟是什么？【原文：As goes the price of oil, so go US rig fleets, which have been getting idled on the shale patch. BloombergNEF has issued its latest energy outlook before the group holds a summit in New York later this month. And exactly what are those rare earth metals China is guarding?】

item.title: MidOcean 同意从丹-吉尔伯特支持的岩桥公司手中收购 GSTV
item.description: 私募股权公司 MidOcean Partners 已同意从亿万富翁丹-吉尔伯特（Dan Gilbert）的私募股权公司手中收购 GSTV（前身为 Gas Station TV），该公司首席执行官在接受采访时说。【原文：Private equity firm MidOcean Partners has agreed to acquire GSTV, formerly known as Gas Station TV, from billionaire Dan Gilbert’s private equity firm, the company’s CEO said in an interview.】

item.title: 智利重要经济学家与总统竞选人托哈合作
item.description: 一群杰出的经济学家正在支持民意调查中落后的智利中左翼总统候选人卡罗琳娜-托哈的竞选。【原文：A group of distinguished economists is supporting the bid of Chilean center-left presidential candidate Carolina Toha, who is lagging in polls.】

item.title: 美国例外论的威胁引发新兴地方债券热潮
item.description: 尽管新兴市场本币债券的收益率甚至低于美国国债，但它们仍被认为会击败以美元计价的同类债券。【原文：Emerging market local-currency bonds are being tipped to beat their dollar-denominated peers despite offering lower yields than even US Treasuries.】

item.title: 意大利可能限制裕信银行 BPM 交易中的分行销售：Corriere
item.description: 据 Corriere della Sera 报道，意大利政府可能要求意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）不得出售北部伦巴第大区的分支机构，作为该银行拟收购竞争对手 Banco BPM 的一部分。【原文：The Italian government could require that UniCredit SpA not sell off branches in the northern region of Lombardy as part of the lender’s proposed takeover of rival Banco BPM, Corriere della Sera reported.】

item.title: 韩国贸易谈判代表将于本周访美会谈
item.description: 韩国最高贸易官员将于本周访问华盛顿，启动贸易谈判，力争成为首批说服特朗普政府放宽或取消对其货物征收关税的国家之一。【原文：South Korea’s top trade official will visit Washington this week to kick start trade negotiations as it seeks to be among the first nations to persuade the Trump administration to ease or eliminate tariffs on its shipments.】

item.title: 日本考虑审查汽车安全规则以与特朗普达成协议
item.description: 据日本商业日报《日经新闻》周日报道，在日本寻求与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普达成贸易协议之际，日本正在研究审查其汽车安全标准。【原文：Japan is looking into reviewing its car safety standards as the country seeks to strike a trade deal with US President Donald Trump, Japanese business daily Nikkei reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 富达、高盛在亚洲消费股中找到关税避风港
item.description: 全球贸易战为亚洲消费类股票带来了利好，因为投资者开始青睐那些满足当地买家基本需求的公司。【原文：The global trade war is providing a boon for Asian consumer stocks, as investors take shelter in companies that cater to local buyers’ essential needs.】

item.title: 特朗普政府请求最高法院解除驱逐禁令
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府要求最高法院收回其阻止将委内瑞拉人驱逐到萨尔瓦多一所臭名昭著的监狱的决定，辩称清晨的命令过于宽泛且不成熟。【原文：President Donald Trump’s administration asked the Supreme Court to roll back its decision to block the deportation of Venezuelans to a notorious prison in El Salvador, arguing that the early-morning order was overbroad and premature.】

item.title: 加勒比海集团称美国对中国船只的豁免 "可以接受
item.description: 加勒比私营部门组织表示，它欢迎特朗普政府决定免除某些前往其港口的中国船只数百万美元的费用。【原文：The Caribbean Private Sector Organization said it welcomed a decision to exempt certain Chinese ships traveling to its ports from millions of dollars in fees proposed by the Trump administration.】

item.title: 法国称解雇鲍威尔将损害美元和美国经济
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴警告说，如果唐纳德-特朗普总统解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔，他将把美元的信誉置于危险境地，并破坏美国经济的稳定。【原文：President Donald Trump would put the credibility of the dollar on the line and destabilize the US economy if he fired Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, French Finance Minister Eric Lombard warned.】

item.title: 特朗普关税的第一波冲击波即将袭击世界经济
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普有效地向全世界宣布贸易战的三周后，新的经济预测和调查将指出最初的影响。【原文：Three weeks after US President Donald Trump effectively declared a trade war with the whole world, new economic forecasts and surveys will point to the initial fallout.】

item.title: 中国首个机器人马拉松选手绊倒、冒烟、摔倒
item.description: 周六，中国一些最优秀的仿人机器人接受了与人类马拉松选手比赛的挑战。其中一个机器人倒在了起跑线上。另一个的头掉了下来，在地上打滚。还有一个机器人倒地摔成了碎片。【原文：Some of China’s best humanoid robots took on the challenge of racing against human marathon runners on Saturday. One fell at the starting line. Another’s head fell off and rolled on the ground. And one collapsed and broke into pieces.】

item.title: 卡尼誓言增加赤字为基础设施和减税提供资金
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）承诺加深赤字以削减所得税，并增加基础设施支出，以减少该国对美国的依赖。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is promising to run deeper deficits to cut income taxes and grow spending on infrastructure to reduce the country’s dependence on the US.】

item.title: 石油交易商从祈求波动到沉溺于波动
item.description: 直到最近，石油交易商们还在抱怨，要想从无精打采、区间震荡的原油市场中榨取利润几乎是不可能的。在经历了过去两周半的事件之后，这可能就是 "小心驶得万年船 "了。【原文：Until recently, oil traders complained that it was almost impossible to wring profits out of a listless and rangebound crude market. After the events of the past two-and-a-half weeks, this may have been a case of “careful what you wish for.”】

item.title: 投资者希望了解企业的支出超过收入的情况
item.description: 华尔街已经开始关注美国企业一年来最慢的季度盈利增长，转而关注一个很少引人注目的数字：资本支出。【原文：Wall Street is already looking past what’s expected to be Corporate America’s slowest gain in quarterly earnings in a year, instead focusing on a number that rarely captures the limelight: capital expenditures.】

item.title: ICICI 银行净收入增长 18%，超出分析师预期
item.description: 受利息收入增加的推动，印度第二大私人贷款机构 ICICI 银行有限公司公布的第四季度利润超出市场预期。【原文：ICICI Bank Ltd., India’s second-largest private lender, posted fourth-quarter profit that beat market expectations, driven by higher interest income.】

item.title: 中国最大贸易博览会上的出口商被告知不要提前离场
item.description: 在与美国的贸易冲突不断升级的背景下，中国最大的贸易博览会的主办方敦促出口商最大限度地利用机会吸引销售，因此不鼓励出口商提前闭馆或离场。【原文：Exporters at China’s largest trade fair have been discouraged from closing or leaving their stations early as organizers push them to maximize opportunities to attract sales amid an escalating trade conflict with the US.】
